My cousin and I spent 2 nights here. It was fine for a short stay as we didn't spend a lot of time in the apartment. There were good and not-so-good things about "Cozy Apartment".
I have stayed in dozens of AirBnb's and have friends that are hosts...and in comparison this apartment could be taken to a new level with a few tweeks in terms of communication, maintenance amenities, and decor.
Good: 1/Apartment was roomy 2/Location was central 3/Carport was an added bonus.
Not so Good:
1/Communication:
Had the host checked in with us after arrival a few issues perhaps could have been remedied.
2/Maintenance.
Bath tub drain toggle would not close so was unable to take a bath. There was an older/rusty faucet in bathroom.
The exterior entry door to apartment was filthy (not very welcoming or hygienic)
Hot water was adequate and was unable to turn it up to be hotter.
3/Amenities:
Kitchen had a Keurig machine but no pods or any other type of coffee maker.
No dish towels, only one dish cloth. Fortunately, we found a roll of paper towels under the counter.
No amenities such as coffee, creamer, salt and pepper, etc for even a one night stay.
Found big bottle of body and shampoo in bath cabinet but had to search.
4/Decor:
Apartment didn't feel cozy, it felt more like a Motel 6 with a kitchen. Very basic decor without a lot of attention to details or aesthetics.
No place to hang or put coats, etc inside the door.
2nd bedroom had very flat, old pillows and the tiny, disproportionate bedside lamp was inadequate. No tables or benches to lay things out.
Upgraded curtains would make bedrooms much more inviting.
There were multiple screws in the walls with nothing hanging from them.
Overall, it was okay, but nothing special. I think for the price, we could have done better perhaps at other Airbnb's or at a motel in the area.
